Speaking.
Oh! Hi, yeah.
translation.ja: どうも こんにちは

translation.en: I agree. I thought the interview went very--
I see.
Yeah, no, I completely understand.
Thank you for calling.
Yeah, you too.
Katie, I assumed you knew. I can't put you back to work,
translation.ja: 知ってると思うが 今は無理だ

translation.en: not until the police finish their investigation.
translation.ja: 警察の捜査が終わるまでは

translation.en: Investigation?
Well, yes, when a client expires under the supervision of an employee,
translation.ja: 従業員の管理下で 顧客が亡くなった場合―

translation.en: we cooperate with the authorities to be absolutely certain that there was...
translation.ja: 我々は警察に協力して 証明しないと…

translation.en: you know, how would it look to a potential client that there was even any hint of--
translation.ja: わずかでも可能性があったら 今後 顧客が…

translation.en: Wait, you think I had something to do with what happened to Leonard?
translation.ja: 私がレナードの死と 関係があるとでも？

translation.en: God, no. No, of course not.
No. This is...
I'm sorry, Katie. This is company policy.
There's nothing I can do until the police officially close their investigation.
translation.ja: 捜査終了まで 何もしてやれない

translation.en: So, how long is this gonna take?
Yeah, I-- I wish I knew.
Hello?
Hey.
What were you thinking?
You can't just come in here like this, like we still belong here.
translation.ja: 前と違うんだから 勝手に入らないで

translation.en: Excuse me. I'm bleeding right now. What do you want from me?
translation.ja: まだ出血してるんだぜ 何が言いたい？

translation.en: We said we'd be careful, Adam! I asked you and you promised me.
translation.ja: あなた 用心するって 約束したじゃない

translation.en: -You promised. -All right. Okay!
translation.ja: その口で！ 分かったよ

translation.en: Look, I--
I'm sorry.
But if I wasn't here, I think that money would be gone.
translation.ja: でも来なきゃ カネは取られてた

translation.en: How could anyone know about the money?
-It's Leonard's. He kept it hidden. -Why else would they be here, Katie?
translation.ja: レナードのお金よ でも誰かいた

translation.en: You didn't see who it was?
No, they came up behind me.
They couldn't have known you were here. They wouldn't have busted in like that.
translation.ja: 向こうはあなたがいるのを 知ってた

translation.en: I heard the glass break. That's why I came down. The back door was already open.
translation.ja: 音がして下に降りたら 裏口が開いてた

translation.en: And you didn't think maybe that was a bad sign, that you should get out?
translation.ja: 逃げるべきだと 思わなかったの？

translation.en: No, I didn't have time to think.
The next thing I know, I was waking up to the sound of my phone ringing.
translation.ja: そんな時間なかった 電話で目が覚めた

translation.en: How could you do this, Adam? This never should have happened. You never should have been here.
translation.ja: 何でこんなことしたの？ 最悪の事態よ

translation.en: -That's not the point! -Then what's the point?
-Almost a hundred grand! That's the point. -You're always trying to justify your--
translation.ja: 10万ドル近い いつも言い訳を…

translation.en: You counted it?
I counted to 92,000, and there was more.
Then she calls me to say how sorry she is that the hiring committee decided to go another way.
translation.ja: 採用委員会は違う候補者を 選んだって電話で言われた

translation.en: Whatever the hell that means.
I don't even know...
They're all just such assholes.
I'm just sick of being poor.
Who was it, Adam?
Who got in here?
Maybe somebody who did some work on the house?
-Sometime before you started. -Leonard talked about hiring a gardener,
translation.ja: お前より前に 庭師がいたって聞いた

translation.en: but that was a couple of years ago.
Well, whoever it was, I don't think it was a coincidence.
translation.ja: 誰だろうと 偶然じゃないな

translation.en: They must have known that Leonard had passed away.
translation.ja: レナードの死も知ってる

translation.en: And figured the house would be empty.
But maybe you're right. Maybe they didn't know about the money.
translation.ja: 奴らはカネの存在を 知らないのかも

translation.en: They probably just wanted to get in and get out. Just grab whatever they can get away with.
translation.ja: 忍び込んで目に付いた物を 盗もうとしただけ

translation.en: What if they come back?
[cashier] All right, right this way.
There you go.
Just ring when you're ready.
Thank you.
[Adam] Babe. [Adam] Dinner's on me.
[Katie] All right.
-Morning. -Morning.
I was just making you coffee.
Ms. Franklin, this is Detective Chesler. We spoke at Mr. Wellsley's house.
translation.ja: フランクリンさん チェスラー刑事です

translation.en: Would you give me a call when you get this message? You have the number. Thanks.
translation.ja: 名刺の番号に 折り返し電話を下さい

translation.en: Sorry to keep you waiting. Thanks for coming in.
translation.ja: お待たせしてすいません

translation.en: Detective. Is there a problem?
Why don't we talk back here?
Did Mr. Wellsley ever mention a will?
translation.ja: ウェルズリーさんの遺書は？

translation.en: No.
And no family?
He was all alone.
Well, something like this,
the rich old man, living alone, no heirs. We just have to cross all of our t's.
translation.ja: 裕福な高齢者の事件は 念入りな捜査が必要でして

translation.en: I'm sorry, Detective.
[stammers] I don't...
What is this about?
Well, you said that Mr. Wellsley asked to be cremated.
translation.ja: ウェルズリーさんの ご希望どおり―

translation.en: So I'm assuming that you want to honor his request.
translation.ja: 火葬されたいんですよね？

translation.en: Yes.
Yes, we do.
Without a family and no will, the question becomes who bears the cost of the arrangements.
translation.ja: 家族や遺書がない場合 費用負担が問題となります

translation.en: We'll take care of Leonard.
Okay. I've got the paperwork right here.
translation.ja: では これが書類です

translation.en: [Adam] What's that?
[Katie] His favorite tea.
For Leonard.
Leonard.
We should put the money back.
It doesn't feel right.
Let's just be here. For Leonard.
translation.ja: レナードと ここにいよう

translation.en: [Katie] We should say something.
"And he shall be like a tree,
planted by the rivers of water.
That bringeth forth his fruit in his season
and whatsoever he doeth shall prosper."
I'm sorry. Who are you?
Apologies, Ms. Franklin. My name is Julia Byron-Kim.
translation.ja: 私は ジュリア･バイロン･キム

translation.en: I'm Mr. Wellsley's attorney.
Ms. Byron-Kim,
Leonard never said anything about an attorney.
translation.ja: レナードから弁護士の話は 聞いてません

translation.en: Please, call me Julia. And I'm not surprised.
translation.ja: ジュリアと でしょうね

translation.en: [Adam] What do you mean?
The first I heard from Mr. Wellsley was only a few weeks ago.
translation.ja: まだ たった数週間ですから

translation.en: He called me out of the blue, wanting me to write up his will, and asked me to come to the house.
translation.ja: 突然 連絡を受け 遺言書の件で訪問しました

translation.en: -I never saw you here. -He was very specific about that.
translation.ja: 私は会ってない 訪問は夜に 限られていました

translation.en: I was to only come in the evenings.
translation.ja: 訪問は夜に 限られていました

translation.en: Why?
He left everything to you.
-Oh, my God! -Congratulations.
translation.ja: 受取人： ケイティ･フランクリン 本当？ 受取人： ケイティ･フランクリン 受取人： ケイティ･フランクリン ええ

translation.en: I don't even know what to say. This is...
Say thank you, Leonard!
Wow.
Okay, so what happens now?
translation.ja: それで どうしたら？

translation.en: First, I suggest you read over the will very carefully. Better yet, I would have your lawyer take a look.
translation.ja: まず よく読んでから ご自身の弁護士に相談を

translation.en: Actually, we don't have a lawyer.
Well, Mr. Wellsley did pay my retainer in advance,
translation.ja: 実は あなたを手伝うよう―

translation.en: asked that I help you through this transition.
translation.ja: 彼に依頼されています

translation.en: What transition? We can't just move in right away?
Of course you can,
with the understanding that the will is going through probate,
which takes about three months.
And if there are any surprises, you should have someone to look after your interests.
translation.ja: 気がかりがあれば 誰か弁護士を雇ってください

translation.en: Now, I understand if you want to find your own lawyer.
translation.ja: ご判断はお任せします

translation.en: You said Leonard called you out of the blue. You didn't know him?
translation.ja: レナードと 面識はなかったんですか？

translation.en: I never met him before.
Why did he call you?
He found me on the Internet. He said that he liked my name.
translation.ja: ネットで見て 名前が気に入ったと

translation.en: Byron was his favorite poet.
translation.ja: バイロンは 彼の好きな詩人です

translation.en: Ms. Byron-Kim.
Sorry, Julia...
translation.ja: すいません ジュリアです

translation.en: I'm kind of new at this. I'm not really sure how to go about it officially, but I could really use your help.
translation.ja: 初めてでよく分からないけど あなたにお願いしたいの

translation.en: There are some big changes coming your way. I hope you're ready.
translation.ja: 大きな変化が訪れます 心の準備を

translation.en: Me too.
And how about Adam?
What about him?
Well, he does understand that legally,
where it comes to this house, you make all the decisions.
translation.ja: 決めるのは全てあなたです

translation.en: We've always decided things together.
Which is how it should be.
These things, you just never know how it can change someone.
translation.ja: 相続や遺産は 人を変えてしまいます

translation.en: We'll be okay.
Good.
translation.ja: では 手続きします

translation.en: -Leave it to me then. -Great.
translation.ja: では 手続きします はい

translation.en: -Congratulations. -Thanks.
We should take a vacation for a month. Just first class all the way.
translation.ja: ファーストクラスで １ヵ月 旅行だ

translation.en: You'll get your MBA before you know it. Find a great job.
translation.ja: ＭＢＡを取って いい仕事に就けるわ

translation.en: -That piece of junk that we drive. -We can pay off everything.
translation.ja: 車も変えよう カードの請求もローンも きれいになくなる

translation.en: Credit cards, loans, just wipe the slate clean.
translation.ja: カードの請求もローンも きれいになくなる

translation.en: You know, we should go right now. Both of us. Just go pick brand new cars.
translation.ja: 今から新車を買いに行くぞ

translation.en: -Come on, Adam. I'm serious. -Yeah, me too.
-We can't do that. -Why not? We have the money.
translation.ja: ダメよ カネはある

translation.en: We can't just walk in there with all that cash. It'll look weird.
translation.ja: 現金で買ったら 質問攻めに遭うでしょ

translation.en: -People are gonna ask questions. -Yeah. No. You're right.
translation.ja: 現金で買ったら 質問攻めに遭うでしょ 確かにそうだ

translation.en: I did some research online and been looking into that.
Into what?
See there's ways we can make it work, right? We just spread the money around. Different banks, different kinds of accounts.
translation.ja: カネを複数の銀行や口座に 分散させる

translation.en: What are you talking about?
If we do this right, it's like nobody will ever know.
translation.ja: うまくやれば 誰も気付かない

translation.en: We can get away with so much in taxes.
Adam.
We still have to be careful.
We have been careful, okay?
Don't you think it's time for us to treat ourselves?
translation.ja: 贅沢(ぜいたく)してもいいだろ？

translation.en: You earned it. God knows I have.
I mean maybe you're right, but we have to settle in first,
translation.ja: そうかもしれないけど まずは落ち着いて

translation.en: take things slow, you know. Just... Just a little while longer. Okay?
translation.ja: 慎重に行きましょ もうしばらくの間は

translation.en: Yeah. Okay.
We'll take it slow.
I'll call the movers. See how soon we can get them over here.
translation.ja: 引っ越し業者に日程を聞くわ

translation.en: What? We don't need any of this stuff.
What? It's our stuff. We've had it since we got married.
Yeah well, here, we'll keep the pictures and some of those books, and we don't need the rest of this junk.
translation.ja: 絵と本は取っておこう 他はゴミだ

translation.en: What are we supposed to do with all of it?
Just leave it for the next poor losers that have to live in this dump, right?
translation.ja: 次に住む貧乏人に残しとけよ

translation.en: -Jeez, Adam. -[phone rings]
Hello?
Yeah, that was five months ago and I already gave the police my statement.
translation.ja: ５ヵ月前に 警察に報告しました

translation.en: Who was it who called you, sir?
I didn't get the name. He just said talk to someone at the front desk.
translation.ja: 名前は聞いてなくて ただ“受付に来い”と

translation.en: I got nothing.
Mr. Kettner, everything okay?
translation.ja: ケトナーさん　何か？

translation.en: He says somebody told him to come down, make a statement.
translation.ja: 聴取のため呼ばれたと

translation.en: What's this regarding?
Like five months ago somebody robbed the Smile Diner, killed somebody.
translation.ja: スマイル･ダイナーの 強盗殺人です

translation.en: You were at the diner that night?
Yes.
Lucky you didn't get hurt.
I kinda stopped the guy.
You did?
Yeah, in that situation, I reacted. My wife was working that night so...
translation.ja: 体が勝手に動いたんです 妻が勤務中で…

translation.en: Ms. Franklin was there too?
Yeah, but what I don't understand is you already have the guy locked up.
translation.ja: でも犯人は 捕まってますよね？

translation.en: Why do they need another statement?
They don't.
What are you talking about?
That guy from the diner, Ray Gaskin.
-Yeah. -He's dead.
Somebody stabbed him in his cell a couple weeks ago.
translation.ja: 数週間前 監房で刺された

translation.en: So who called me?
Kind of wondering that myself.
Excuse me?
Hello, Katie. Do you remember me?
translation.ja: やあ 僕を覚えてる？

translation.en: Yeah, what are you doing back here?
I know, a pain in the ass, right? But my client, he's driving me nuts.
translation.ja: これは失礼 依頼主がうるさいもので

translation.en: He just-- He absolutely loves the place. I think he wants to make an offer.
translation.ja: この家が どうしても欲しくて― 買う気でいる

translation.en: I told you already.
It's not for sale.
Maybe, if I could speak with the owner myself,
translation.ja: 持ち主と会って話せれば―

translation.en: at least I can say I tried.
Look, I'm really busy and you can't just show up here like this, so...
translation.ja: 忙しいの 勝手に入ってこないで

translation.en: I want you to go now. Please.
You know, Katie? This ain't my first rodeo.
translation.ja: いいかい 駆け引きはいつものことだ

translation.en: You know, one of the first lessons in real estate...
translation.ja: 不動産業界の教えにある

translation.en: if you want to find new listings, check the obituaries.
translation.ja: “新しい物件が欲しけりゃ 訃報欄を読め”

translation.en: I know all about the late Mr. Wellsley.
translation.ja: ウェルズリー氏のことは 全部 知ってる

translation.en: Sad.
The house isn't for sale.
You know, I've had my eye on this house for a couple years.
The old man...
kicks the bucket...
and you think you can just move in?
I'm gonna smile? Wish you well?
translation.ja: 俺が笑って祝福するって？

translation.en: I own the house now.
What the hell are you saying?
Leonard left it to me.
I have his will, I can prove it.
Yeah, well for five grand I can make a new will that says it belongs to my dear Aunt Myrtle.
translation.ja: 5000ドルで俺の叔母さんの 名義に書き換えよう

translation.en: I have a lawyer.
Of course you do.
If you have any more questions, I suggest you talk to her
translation.ja: 質問があれば 私の弁護士にどうぞ

translation.en: but, in the meantime, get the hell off my property before I call the police.
translation.ja: 質問があれば 私の弁護士にどうぞ 通報する前に出てって

translation.en: All right. Well, I guess I'll see you around, Katie.
translation.ja: それなら出直すとしようか

translation.en: He's just messing with you.
It's not how it sounded.
He practically accused me of forging the will.
translation.ja: 私が遺書を偽造したって

translation.en: Babe, trust me.
The thing this guy cares about is what he's losing on commission.
translation.ja: 手数料欲しさに言うだけさ

translation.en: Maybe I should talk to Julia.
The lawyer? Why?
In case Hayden tries to make trouble?
translation.ja: 面倒が起きないように

translation.en: What could he do?
I don't know but it's like she said, we don't want any surprises right now.
translation.ja: やっかい事を今は避けたいの

translation.en: Katie.
This guy is just pissed off. Forget about him.
translation.ja: 奴は頭にきてるだけさ 気にするな

translation.en: Come on. It's our first night in our new house.
translation.ja: この家で迎える最初の夜だ

translation.en: We should celebrate.
Yeah?
What did you have in mind?
I can think of something.
-Let me take a shower first. -What?
I've been cleaning the house all day. I'll be right out.
What is this?
My old one stopped working, so...
Looks expensive.
Well, it's a knock off. Just bought it from some guy downtown.
translation.ja: 偽物だよ　路上で買ったんだ

translation.en: Very convincing.
You want company?
I'll be right out.
Detective!
-Looks like I came at a bad time. -No, you're fine. Come in.
translation.ja: お邪魔かしら いいえ　どうぞ

translation.en: You folks going somewhere?
Yeah, we're moving, actually, into Leonard's house.
translation.ja: 実はレナードの家に 移るんです

translation.en: Leonard?
As in Mr. Wellsley?
I know. I'm still getting used to the idea myself.
translation.ja: 私も 実感がないんですけど―

translation.en: Leonard left it to me in his will.
translation.ja: 遺言で私に 残してくれたんです

translation.en: Now then, that is a very nice house.
translation.ja: なるほど　立派なお屋敷よね

translation.en: Yes, it is.
-Congratulations. -Thank you.
So, a thing like that, what do they call it?
translation.ja: こういうの 何て呼ぶのかしら？

translation.en: A windfall.
Doesn't happen every day.
Nope.
Funny you forgot to mention it.
What?
The will, and all, when we spoke. I asked you about his family, about a will.
translation.ja: 遺族を確認した時 遺書の話をしなかった

translation.en: Oh no, I didn't know about it until after the service. His lawyer came by.
translation.ja: お葬式で 弁護士から聞いたんです

translation.en: That must've been quite a shock.
Yeah, it was.
I'd have loved to see the look on your face.
translation.ja: その顔が見たかったわ

translation.en: You know, I mean you worked there for...
what did you say? Four months?
Why are you here, Detective?
I was hoping to speak with your husband.
He's not here.
Well, maybe you can help me.
translation.ja: じゃ 手伝ってくれる？

translation.en: See, I was wondering
when you worked nights at that place, the Smile Diner,
translation.ja: 彼は毎晩 スマイル･ダイナーまで―

translation.en: did he pick you up all the time?
I mean, he picked you up before.
translation.ja: 前にも迎えに来たことが？

translation.en: Yeah.
Right, but was it a set thing? Was it every night, was it certain nights?
translation.ja: 毎晩とか特定の曜日とか 決まってた？

translation.en: No, not exactly.
So how did he happen to be there that night?
translation.ja: なぜ あの晩は迎えを？

translation.en: I-- I called him to pick me up and he came early to study.
translation.ja: 私が電話で迎えを頼みました 彼は早めに来て勉強を

translation.en: Well, you ought to play the lottery, Katie.
translation.ja: ねえ 宝くじを買ったら？

translation.en: You're a very lucky woman.
Does this have anything to do with the fact that
the police called Adam about making another statement?
translation.ja: 警察が彼を もう一度 呼び出したのと

translation.en: He didn't tell you?
Police never called Adam.
No, I was here. They called him down at the station.
translation.ja: 電話があった時 私もいました

translation.en: No, I checked it out after he left.
There's no record of any calls to his number.
translation.ja: 警察が電話した記録は なかった

translation.en: That doesn't make any sense. Why would-- Why would anyone... send him down there for no reason?
translation.ja: じゃ 誰が理由もなく 彼を呼び出したんです？

translation.en: Well, maybe they had a reason.
Maybe it's just not the one you think.
Take care now.
[Katie] Thanks, Julia. I'll talk to you later, bye.
Katie.
What did she want?
I called her, actually.
What did you tell her?
Nothing.
That's not how it looked.
Looked like you guys were best friends all of a sudden.
Well, maybe if you'd been here, maybe if you'd answered your phone...
translation.ja: あなたが家にいるか 電話ででも話せれば…

translation.en: We agreed.
We decided you were not going to talk to her.
No, you decided.
Like you've been deciding a lot of things lately.
translation.ja: 最近 何でも自分で決める

translation.en: What are you even talking about?
Why didn't you tell me that it wasn't the police who called you?
translation.ja: 警察は 電話しなかったんでしょ？

translation.en: It was somebody else who made sure you went down there, right?
translation.ja: 誰かがあなたを誘い出した

translation.en: Who told you that?
Detective Chesler dropped by.
translation.ja: チェスラー刑事が来たの

translation.en: And she was asking a lot of questions,
about you, about what happened the night of the diner.
translation.ja: あなたや ダイナーの事件について

translation.en: What is that about,
Adam?
[scoffs] How should I know?
Who called?
-Who sent you to the police station? -I don't know!
translation.ja: 誰が警察に呼んだの？ 知るか

translation.en: My bad, I was gonna tell you about it. It's a whole lot of other stuff has been happening right now.
translation.ja: 言おうと思ってたけど いろいろあって

translation.en: What other stuff?
I think I'm being followed.
What?
I kind of had the feeling before.
Today, I just went driving around, just around.
translation.ja: 今日 車で グルグル走ってみた

translation.en: I kept seeing the same car.
Did you go to the bank?
-Come on, we said we would not do that. -No, Adam. No bullshit.
translation.ja: 行かないと約束したろ

translation.en: Just tell me. Did you go to the bank today?
Did you take money out?
I noticed him.
So I figured, you know, it wouldn't be a good idea. Just in case.
translation.ja: 万が一 金目当てなら マズいと思った

translation.en: In case he was after the money.
-We don't know that. -Why else is he watching you?
translation.ja: そうだ 尾行する理由は？

translation.en: Look, maybe I'm just paranoid.
Okay? Maybe there's nobody who's following me. I don't know.
translation.ja: 尾行なんかないのかも

translation.en: You got sent down to the police station, Adam.
That way, I'm here alone. That way, Hayden shows up, tries to intimidate me,
translation.ja: 私が独りになると ヘイデンが現れ脅してきた

translation.en: scare us out of the house. What is that? Why is he here?
translation.ja: なぜ彼はここにいたの？

translation.en: Because he probably knows.
I warned you.
Chesler.

translation.ja: ダイヤを 持ち逃げされた理由は？

translation.en: Because he wasn't half as smart as he wanted you to think.
I mean how smart do you have to be to decide to rip off your partner,
translation.ja: 相棒を殺そうなんて バカでしかない

translation.en: shoot him while the cops are rolling up,
and he still gets away with three million dollars in diamonds?
translation.ja: 300万ドルのダイヤは 持ち逃げされ―

translation.en: Meanwhile, you get busted and spend two years in prison.
translation.ja: 刑務所に２年 ぶち込まれた

translation.en: I never told you how much the diamonds are worth.
translation.ja: ダイヤの価値は話してない

translation.en: Oops.
-What are you doing? -Look, okay, I paid my dues.
translation.ja: そんな 自分で学費を払って 公選弁護人を10年やったわ

translation.en: Okay, I spent ten years as a public defender.
translation.ja: 自分で学費を払って 公選弁護人を10年やったわ

translation.en: How do you think I got Hayden's case?
I knew he was an idiot. But I believed his story.
translation.ja: バカな奴だけど話を信じたわ

translation.en: And we had an agreement, an understanding, and, of course, he messes everything up.
translation.ja: 取り決めを交わしたのに ぶち壊しよ

translation.en: I plea bargained his charges down to two years. I traced Doyle back to when he worked for Leonard.
translation.ja: 奴の刑期を縮め イーサンの隠れ先を追った

translation.en: But the only thing that I couldn't figure out
translation.ja: イーサンの居場所だけが―

translation.en: was where he was.
Turns out Doyle was dead.
You helped kill Leonard?
No, I had nothing to do with that, okay? That was all Hayden. He got impatient.
translation.ja: 私は関係ないわ ヘイデンが焦っただけ

translation.en: He wanted to hurry things along, but I did have to do some fast maneuvering to cover up for him.
translation.ja: 奴が急いだせいで 余計な細工が必要だった

translation.en: The will.
It isn't real, is it?
It's real enough.
With no one to contest it, what's the difference?
Look, I'm sure Leonard would've given you the house if he was alive,
translation.ja: どっちみち あなたに残したはず

translation.en: but that is beside the point.
Right now, I need you to tell me where the diamonds are.
translation.ja: 今すぐ― ダイヤの場所を教えなさい

translation.en: I don't know.
Katie.
Adam hid them.
I really don't know where they are.
But I wouldn't tell you if I did.
You know, that's what I really liked about you.
-[cocks gun] -It was never about the money.
But I'm sure they'll turn up. These things always do.
translation.ja: 捜し物は いずれ出てくるはずだから

translation.en: -Katie? -Detective!
I'm Julia Byron-Kim. I'm Ms. Franklin's attorney.
translation.ja: 弁護士の ジュリア･バイロン･キムです

translation.en: Well, Ms. Byron-Kim,
I'm gonna need you to step out so I can see both your hands.
If you just give me a minute to explain on behalf of my client.
translation.ja: 依頼人に代わって説明を

translation.en: Show me your hands. Right now!
All right.
-Detective, if you would just listen-- -Look out!
Stay back.
Are you okay?
Are you okay? You're okay, sweetie. You're okay.
Come on.
Come on. Let's get you out of here, come on.
This is Detective Chesler.
I'm requesting a back-up and an ambulance at 127 Queens.
translation.ja: クイーンズ通り127番地に 応援と救急車を

translation.en: FOUR MONTHS LATER
Katie.
-Hey. -Detective.
Sorry, I tried knocking.
Sorry, I was...
a million miles away.
A young cedar. This is a nice spot.
translation.ja: ヒマヤラスギ？ いい場所に植えたわね

translation.en: -Lots of sun. -Yeah, I think so.
translation.ja: ヒマヤラスギ？ いい場所に植えたわね でしょう

translation.en: -It's good to see you. -And it's good to see you.
You look beautiful.
Thank you. Yeah, we're... We're doing well.
translation.ja: 私もおなかの子も順調です

translation.en: Well I just came by to let you know that the case is officially closed.
translation.ja: 捜査が正式に終了したのを 知らせに

translation.en: Mickey Hayden and Julia Byron-Kim are the only suspects on record.
translation.ja: 有罪なのは ヘイデンとジュリアだけ

translation.en: So your baby won't grow up to someday find out her father had a criminal history.
translation.ja: おなかの子の父親に 犯罪歴は残らない

translation.en: Thank you, Detective.
translation.ja: ありがとうございます

translation.en: We've been through that place a half a dozen times,
top to bottom.
Still can't figure it out.
He didn't tell me. I really don't know where Adam hid the diamonds.
translation.ja: ダイヤの場所は 聞いてないんです

translation.en: I'm sorry, though. I wish I did.
Take care of yourself, Katie.
You too.
♪ And I'll be standing next to you ♪
translation.ja: 日本語字幕　大川 真咲
